summary: A confidential memorandum from a forensic psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 24, 2019, recommending that inmate Jeffrey Epstein be removed from suicide watch and placed on psychological observation. This document was created just weeks before Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of the memorandum, identified by his BOP number #76318-054, being recommended for removal from suicide watch.

persons.name: Lieutenants
persons.context: The recipients of the memorandum, addressed to the Lieutenants' Office at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: A forensic psychologist issues a memorandum recommending inmate Jeffrey Epstein be removed from suicide watch and placed on psychological observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, a forensic psychologist formally recommended Jeffrey Epstein be removed from suicide watch.
Epstein was identified by his Bureau of Prisons number #76318-054.
The recommendation was to place Epstein on 'Psychological Observation' instead of suicide watch.
The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and originated from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
This official action occurred approximately two weeks before Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
